summary.text:
Multiple count Hansen-Hurwitz estimator.
$$ \hat{Y} = \sum_{i \in S} \frac{y_i}{\mu_i}S_i , $$
$$ n = |S| . $$
variable of interest of size n, $y_i$.
expected number of inclusions of size n, $\mu_i$.
number of inclusions of size n, $S_i$.
$$ \hat{V}(\hat{Y}) = \sum_{i \in S} \sum_{j \in S} \frac{y_i y_j}{\mu_i \mu_j} S_i S_j \frac{\mu_{ij} - \mu_i \mu_j}{\mu_{ij}} $$
variable of interest of size n, $y_i$.
expected number of inclusions of size n, $\mu_i$.
number of inclusions of size n, $S_i$.

second order expected number of inclusions of size n*n,
  upper triangular matrix, $\mu_{ij}$.

Single count Horvitz-Thompson estimator of the total
$$ \hat{Y} = \sum_{i \in S} \frac{y_i}{\pi_i} , $$
$$ n = |S| . $$
variable of interest of size n, $y_i$.
inclusion probabilities of size n, $\pi_i$.
$$ \hat{V}(\hat{Y}) = \sum_{i \in S} \sum_{j \in S} \frac{y_i y_j}{\pi_i \pi_j} \frac{\pi_{ij} - \pi_i \pi_j}{\pi_{ij}} $$
variable of interest of size n, $y_i$.
inclusion probabilities of size n, $\pi_i$.

second order inclusion probabilities of size n*n,
  upper triangular matrix, $\pi_{ij}$.
variable of interest of size n, $y_i$.
inclusion probabilities of size n, $\pi_i$.
variable of interest of size n, $y_i$.
inclusion probabilities of size n, $\pi_i$.
auxilliary variables of size n*p.

Sen-Yates-Grundy HT-variance estimator of a fixed sample size

$$ \hat{V}(\hat{Y}) = -\frac{1}{2} \sum_{i \in S} \sum_{j \in S} (y_i / \pi_i - y_j / \pi_j)^2 \frac{\pi_{ij} - \pi_i \pi_j}{\pi_{ij}} $$
variable of interest of size n, $y_i$.
inclusion probabilities of size n, $\pi_i$.

second order inclusion probabilities of size n*n,
  upper triangular matrix, $\pi_{ij}$.

$$ \hat{Y} = \sum_{i \in S} y_i n_i , $$
where $n_i$ is the number of units in the population closer to unit $i$
than to any other unit.
variable of interest of size n.
auxilliary variables of size N*p.
sample indices, in the same order as the y-values.

Ratio estimator, where a true total $X$ is available for the population.
$$ \hat{T} = \frac{ \hat{Y} }{ \hat{X} } X , $$
where $\hat{Y}, \hat{X}$ are
HT-estimators

population total, $X$.

$$ \hat{Y} = \sum_{i=1}^n \frac{y_i}{n p_i} $$
